channel.title: How to port forward without a router?
channel.description: I need to know how to port forward without a router ive got a wireless modem from quest please tell me i can cause i have no idea were my router is. Please tell me there is some other way to set up a port or something please help me someone i really need help. And i really want to do this.

item.title: How to port forward without a router?
item.dc:creator: @BlackThursday BlackThursday
item.description:
@BlackThursday wrote:

Oops… my bad on that. Its a bit late I’ll have to apologize there. I meannt:

If you don’t have a router, you wont have to port forward. However, certain ISPs block certain ports due to their “security concerns/protection” what have you.

There we go. Thanks for calling me on that

OH and in addition, if you have a router, you still may not have to portforward due to uPnP (thats universal plug and play).

Read full topic
item.source: How to port forward without a router?

item.title: How to port forward without a router?
item.dc:creator: @VB7_Rocks VB7 Rocks
item.description:
@VB7_Rocks wrote:

BlackThursday:

Well, if you have a router, you wont have to portforward I don’t think. You should be all set.

fail

((Now I would leave it at just that, but FYI, routers are the reason you do need to port forward for certain things. If you don’t have a router, all ports are already automatically forwarded to whatever is hooked up to the modem.))

Read full topic

item.title: How to port forward without a router?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

You can’t “port forward” if you don’t have a router. A router has a firewall, and you need to allow ports to use them, this is known as port-forwarding.

Read full topic
item.source: How to port forward without a router?

item.title: How to port forward without a router?
item.dc:creator: @gothic_queen casey.
item.description:
@gothic_queen wrote:

[quote=“bowserjr2, post:3, topic:172614”][quote author=Casey. link=topic=232782.msg1991540#msg1991540 date=1200115634]
Moparscape.org/smf
[/quote]
Did *he say something about Server, No it also can be problems with torrents.[/quote]

[quote=“imrich93, post:10, topic:10733”]Anyone ive got a wireless modem from quest plz tell me i can or is there any other way to get my server working the server ip is

pur3scap3.servequake.com

this is my first server so is there any other way to make it so people can play on it[/quote]

He posted that in another thread, which led me to believe this was mscp related.
